dt: {bc}a process in which a poor area (as of a city) experiences an influx of middle-class or wealthy people who renovate and rebuild homes and businesses and which often results in an increase in property values and the displacement of earlier, usually poorer residents

dt.t: {ldquo}This week, we're talking about {wi}gentrification{/wi}. Middle-class people move in. Property values and rents rise. Things change and improve but not for everyone. …{rdquo}
Opposition is also stoked by fear of {wi}gentrification{/wi}—displacement of longtime residents through higher rents or property taxes.
The construction of luxury housing and {wi}gentrification{/wi} of neighborhoods is pushing families out of communities they have called home for years.
In an effort to keep {wi}gentrification{/wi} from creeping in the same way into the 30th Ward … Jessica Gutierrez wants to keep a lid on property taxes and inform residents about affordable housing.

shortdef: a process in which a poor area (as of a city) experiences an influx of middle-class or wealthy people who renovate and rebuild homes and businesses and which often results in an increase in property values and the displacement of earlier, usually poorer residents
